intro: Phyllanthus lokohensis, commonly known as the Lokohense phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features include smooth, glabrous stems and alternate leaf arrangement. It is of interest in ethnobotanical studies due to its potential medicinal properties.
